intro: The Jews have been commemorating the Passover for thousands of years now. What do you know about its origins?

questions.ask: What kind of animal did God tell the Israelites to slaughter and eat during the Passover?
Where were the Israelites to apply some of the blood from the Passover sacrifice?
Who was to die in Egyptian households on the night of Passover?
What baking product was banned from Israelite homes for an entire week during the Passover celebration?
What was the requirement for male slaves and foreigners to eat the Passover meal?

intro: You probably already know that the Pharisees - the religious leaders of the day - had an ongoing battle with Jesus. Can you remember specifics of their conflict?

questions.ask: What civic duty did the Pharisees hope to use to get Jesus in trouble with Caesar?
What short word, meaning "trouble," did Jesus pronounce on the Pharisees seven times in one speech?
What did Jesus do on a Sabbath day that so infuriated the Pharisees they began plotting to kill Him?
What type of person did Jesus use to contrast with the self-righteous Pharisees in a parable on humility?
What did Jesus say the Pharisees would see in response to their demand for a sign from heaven?

intro: The perfect politician - Pilate said he could find no fault in Jesus, but allowed Him to be crucified anyway. What else do you know about this Roman official?

questions.ask: What symbolic act did Pontius Pilate perform to try to brush aside responsibility for Jesus' crucifixion?
What position of authority did Pontius Pilate hold?
Who urged Pontius Pilate to leave Jesus alone after having a dream about Him?
What three-word question did Pontius Pilate utter after Jesus said He had come into the world to testify to the truth?
What fellow government official - formerly an enemy - became Pontius Pilate's friend during Jesus' trial?'

intro: You don't have to be an accountant to understand the Bible's system of profit and loss. Can you add to your score by answering these five questions?

questions.ask: What did the apostle Paul say is profitable, or useful, for teaching, rebuking, correcting, and training in righteousness?
What did Jesus say a man could forfeit negating the gain of "the whole world"?
What, along with godliness, did the apostle Paul tell Timothy "is great gain"?
Whose loss, according to the book of Romans, meant "riches" for the Gentiles?
How did Paul describe everything he had lost in his life in his efforts to gain Christ?
